The video is very good, however it creates the impression that we would be massless if it weren't for the Higgs Field. This is not true, as our mass is mainly due to the mass of the neutron and the proton. The mass of the quarks is indeed due to the Higgs Field. But although protons and neutrons consist of quarks, their mass would be almost unchanged if the quarks were massless. If you don't believe that just add up the masses of  two up and one bottom quark. You will see that you come nowhere near the mass of the proton. The major part of the proton mass can in fact be explained by QCD without the necessity of the Higgs field.

@RockWontDie14  (2) In particle physics, physicists discovered that imposing certain symmetry groups onto the QFT Lagrangian gives you the equations for certain forces - SU(2) X U(1) gives you weak radioactive decay and electromagnetism, and SU(3) gives you the strong force.  Since the Higgs interacts via the weak force, and has two complex components, we say it's a complex dublet under SU(2).  U(1) requires the photon be massless for it to respect it's transformations.

(1) @RockWontDie14 Those terms like 'SU(2)' and 'U(1)' are called symmetry groups.  They encode what kind of things you can do to an object without changing it.  For example, classical physics is invariant under rotations - I can rotate everything, but the physics remains the same.  So, we say the classical Lagrangian (the mathematical term that encodes the equations of motion) is invariant under transformations of the rotation group in three dimensions, O(3).

According to general relativity, spacetime bends around a massive object, such as a planet or a black hole. Photons travel along whatever path is shortest in space time. When far from planets and black holes, space is unbent, so this path is simply a straight line. When spacetime gets significantly bent, as around a black hole, the shortest path is actually no longer a line. Photons traveling along these paths head towards the center of the black hole, hence the black hole "sucks them up".
